{"step_by_step_thinking": "The finish line of a complete metal cast crown is the edge where the crown meets the tooth. According to Document [1], different finish lines behave differently in facilitating the escape of the cement. The document also mentions that the finish lines like shoulder preparations allow good seating. Document [18] also mentions that the shoulder and shoulder with bevel finish lines provided better crown retention than the chamfer. Document [26] also mentions that the shoulder finish line provides a better marginal fit for resin composite crowns. Therefore, the shoulder finish line seems to be the most suitable for complete metal cast crowns.", "answer_choice": "D. Shoulder"}
